* Stay current with new features, releases, and enhancements for D365FO
* Evaluate the impact new releases and upgrades can have on the organisation's sales & marketing operations and collaborate with IT, to arrange and carry out system upgrades



  





**Your Competencies:** 



* 3+ year of practical experience with Dynamics 365 Finance and/or Supply Chain Management
* Hands-on experience working in a consulting environment, within a global delivery team
* Proven expertise in system integration



  





**About You:** 



* **Self-driven and solution oriented** 
 professional, paired with a methodical, structured, and pro-active work ethic
* Solid documentations abilities, harmonised with a deep commitment to all tasks and projects
* Seamless communicator with stakeholders on all levels, coupled with effective collaboration withing a team, while keeping a positive and engaging approach
* **Resilient and agile,** 
 capable of adapting and resolving challenges with ease



  





**What's on offer:** 



* Employee Share Program
* Professional/career development, training, and certification investments
* Collaborative culture
* Hybrid and flexible work environment

title: Continuous Integration Specialist
description:
### **Responsibilities**


* Develop and enhance our CI/CD build chain and associated processes to maintain optimal software quality.
* Manage and update existing scripts and tools to accommodate the evolving software landscape.
* Identify and implement new tools and scripts to empower our developers.
* Provide expert support to software developers on day-to-day issues related to the build chain.


**Requirements**


* Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent.
* Proven experience with CI/CD systems.
* Background in DevOps engineering.
* Familiarity with Azure cloud infrastructure.


**Desired Skills**


* Proficiency in Zuul.
* Strong skills in Python, Git/Gerrit, Ansible, Docker, Linux.
* Experience with Matlab, SIL, and model-based systems (Simulink/TargetLink).

title: Tech Lead Nordic EDI team, Solna/Hybrid
description:
*Are you an experienced software developer looking to take the next step in your career? Do you want to lead a dynamic team at one of the Nordic region's largest companies? If you have a passion for full-stack development and cloud platforms, this is the job for you!*

**Join us:**
------------


The IT department at PostNord consists of a dedicated team responsible for driving innovation and delivering high-quality software solutions. Our mission is to support the organization's strategic goals by developing scalable and efficient systems. We foster a collaborative and inclusive culture where every team member's contribution is valued.

**Job duties**
--------------


As a Tech Lead at PostNord, you will be responsible for guiding our development team and ensuring the successful delivery of software projects. Your role will include:

* Leading the design, development, and deployment of full-stack applications
* Building and maintaining microservice architecture
* Implementing best practices in software development and ensuring code quality
* Improve and review technical processes to enhance productivity
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
* Mentoring and coaching team members to foster their professional growth
* Driving the adoption of Agile methodologies and DevOps practices
* Ensuring the stability and scalability of our applications in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP)

**We are looking for you who have**
-----------------------------------

### **Experience: (Need-to-have)**

* Several years of experience in software development with a strong emphasis on full-stack development
* High proficiency in Java, Spring Boot or Quarkus
* Good understanding of Angular, Vue, or an equivalent frontend framework
* Experience in building microservices
* Experience with messaging and streaming solutions using ActiveMQ, Kafka, and Kafka Streams
* Experience with Git, Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift, Portainer, and CI/CD tools like Bitbucket Pipelines and GitHub Actions
* Experience with relational Database like Oracle or Postgres and non-relational like Redis
* Understanding of container orchestration platforms and experience deploying production software
* Solid understanding of software architecture, design patterns, and best practices
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think critically
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions on schedule
* Experience with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices is a plus
* Fluent in English in speaking and writing

### **Meritorious experience: (Nice-to-have)**

* Mobile app development
* Fluent in Swedish

**We believe you are a person that is:**
----------------------------------------

* Thorough, analytical, and quick to learn new systems
* Inclusive, structured, and responsible in your working style
* Able to handle stressful situations and prioritize tasks independently
* Communicative and easy to collaborate with, building and nurturing long-term relationships

**We offer you**
----------------


We offer a variety of work in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities to develop creative solutions and work in a prestige-free group where we jointly help to reach our goals. PostNord is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool

Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation  
* 

**We make everyday life easier**
--------------------------------


PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at postnord.com

**Apply**
---------


We look forward to receive your application! If you have any questions or concerns, please contact manager Carolina Lunde on carolina.lunde@postnord.com. Don't wait to submit your application as we go through the applications on an ongoing basis.


We are looking forward to hear from you!


For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga

title: Senior Network Automation Engineer
description:
Senior Network Automation Engineer


Swedium Global is looking for Senior Network Automation Engineer for one of its customer


Location: Stockholm, Marievik


**Role Overview**: We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Network Automation Engineer to be a part of our automating network journey. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, leadership, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively. If you are passionate about network automation and have a proven track record in this field, we want to hear from you!  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Design, develop, and implement network automation solutions using Python and Ansible.
* Manage and maintain Linux-based systems.
* Apply DevOps principles to streamline workflows, including CI/CD processes.
* Oversee software development processes, including testing, code analysis, and release management.
* Lead network automation initiatives with a focus on routing, switching, and working with Cisco and Aruba technologies.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive projects to completion.
* Independently manage development tasks and initiatives, even in the absence of clear direction.


**Qualifications:**  

* Senior-level proficiency in Python.
* Experience with Ansible.
* Experience with Linux system
* Proven DevOps experience, including CI/CD workflows.
* Solid understanding of software development processes and best practices.
* 4-5 years of experience in network automation.
* Expertise in network engineering, particularly with routing, switching, and Cisco/Aruba technologies.
* Ability to work effectively both as part of a team and independently.

  
Job Overview


* Location : Stockholm, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : Python, Ansible, CI/CD, Linux, Cisco, Aruba, Routing, Switching

title: Senior Project Manager
description:
**Senior Project Manager**

  

Verisure is looking for an enthusiastic and driven Senior Project Manager to work within Product Application & Platform organization.

**About the role**


You will be working with stakeholder management, requirement management, estimations, planning, budget follow-up and co-ordination between multiple teams in a devops context both with internal teams and with partners.


You will need to be comfortable in driving technical design and solution conversations, root cause analysis exercises and technical workshops, both on high-level and in detail. The work is focused on projects that require leadership of cross-functional collaborations and deliverables, stakeholder management along with external partner facing collaborations.

**The role includes also:**

* be an interface towards and collaborate with Product Management and Solution Architects
* maintain and continue to build strong relationships with stakeholders
* contribute to process optimizations based on business needs and company strategy


Can you also contribute with a we can do attitude, truly care about teams, be passionate, positive and see possibilities in a challenging environment? Then this is the right job for you.

**Qualifications**:

* 7-10 years + of experience as a Project Manager in the software industry
* Strong leadership and team management abilities
* Well documented experiences from Project Management methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Hybrid)
* Proven experience in managing cross-functional teams, excellent communication and a passion for delivering results
* Experienced in Product Development including HW is an advantage

**What you bring**


You are a team player with excellent communication skills, ensuring everyone stays informed and aligned. You are structured, like problem solving and ensure your own performance. At Verisure it is important to cooperate, so we are looking for a helpful mindset. You are flexible, able to adapt to changes and stay calm under pressure. Verisure is characterized by a very humble environment and we support you in the best way for you to be able to contribute.

**About Verisure**


Verisure is a global leading provider of professionally monitored security solutions. We are an international company with a start-up mindset, fast, agile, and lean, high-performance and value driven. We protect million of customers in 17 countries. Our business model integrates product development, design and sales with installation, outstanding service and a 24/7 professional monitoring solution. We protect people from intrusion, fire, and flood - and we save lives.


Over the past years, Verisure has experienced an exceptional and resilient financial performance with a very long track record of double-digit growth - thanks to continuous drive for Innovation, our very sophisticated Go-To-Market approach and replicable business model for expansion into new countries. We are now supporting the business’ next phase of growth with a robust business plan for value creation. Verisure’s success depends on its people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading world-class company that has a strong entrepreneurial spirit.


Verisure Innovation is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from diverse backgrounds. We are an international company with offices and colleagues in multiple countries.
company_description: Verisure, a fast growing company full of career opportunities. Verisure Belgium is part of a global organisation active in 14 countries.

title: Senior Teknisk Projektledare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**

  

* Samordna och koordinera de tekniska leveranserna i projektet för att säkerställa framdrift enligt plan.
* Säkerställa att projektets ingående tekniska delprojekt levereras enligt beslutad arkitektur och enligt best practice.
* Leda arbetet att ta fram underlag för beslut och resultat genom att planera, genomföra och dokumentera workshops och intervjuer med nyckelpersoner, experter och intressenter.
* Bidra med egen kompetens inom IT Infrastruktur och teknik.
* Koordinera gränssnitt mellan de olika tekniska deluppdragen.
* Rapportera till projektledare och styrgrupp.
* Stötta projektledare och projektägare i att ta fram nödvändiga underlag enligt ovanstående premisser och anvisningar samt styr- och projektmodeller.
* Ansvara för att projektet levereras inom givna tidsramar.
* Leda interna tekniska specialister på ett tydligt sätt
* Skapa en positiv och stödjande arbetsmiljö (utan arbetsmiljöansvar) för teamets medlemmar.

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**

  

* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat som projektledare inom IT Infrastruktur de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från verksamhet med hög skyddsklass involverande kritiska IT-system med höga tillgänglighets- och säkerhetskrav
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat i projekt/program i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet under de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av ett större tekniskt infrastruktur-projekt (>100 MSEK) under de senaste 10 åren. *Obs! Projektbudget för uppdraget måste framgå i CV*
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av minst 2 uppdrag i ett större komplext IT-projekt/program dvs med flertalet interna och externa intressenter.

  

**Meriterande**  

* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet, under de senaste 10 åren, av arbete i MS Azure DevOps som projektverktyg
* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet av komplex(a) internationell(a) program/projekt med daglig kommunikation av teknisk- och ekonomiskt komplex karaktär
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT Infrastruktur inom offentlig sektor, myndighet och/eller statligt affärsverk
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att leda projekt med införande av zon-segmenterad IT-infrastruktur.

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 10-12-2024  

  

**Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?  


Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: License Specialist
description:
Welcome to Eficode!


We are building the future of software - specializing in Cloud, DevOps, Agile, and Development. We help our customers transform into software-driven organizations, aiming to change the world by sharing our knowledge. Our employees value: opportunities for growth, psychological safety and culture - we appreciate our laid-back and autonomous, but supportive atmosphere.

*Eficode is now looking for a License Specialist for our Scandinavian team*

**Your role and responsibilities**  

  

You will be part of a team of three people, working at the crossroads of our customers, partners and sales team to manage and coordinate resale of software licenses.


We act as a support function for our customers in everything regarding their licenses. We support them with quotes, invoices and advising.


In this role, you will:

* Communicate regularly with vendors and customers
* Prepare license resale quotations for customers
* Lead sales opportunities to completion
* Support customers and colleagues in licensing matters
* Work with your team to find creative solutions together
* Learn every day!
* 

**What skills are we looking for?**


As a professional, you are thorough, accurate, organized, business minded and communicate effectively.


To be successful in this role, you will also need:

* Curiosity and an eagerness to learn
* Service mindedness
* A collaborative mindset

**The following are advantageous:**

* Experience with Atlassian tools
* Experience in license management
* Experience in Salesforce

**Why us?**

* Eficode is a fusion of bright minds working on groundbreaking projects.
* We provide opportunities to work with leading businesses in Europe and the US.
* We work in a diverse environment that respects experience, nurtures talent, and encourages growth.
* Open collaboration and clear communication are the cornerstones of our organizational culture.
* With our own Efi Academy, internal trainings and mentoring program, we are committed to supporting your development.
* On top of your compensation, we offer an attractive package of benefits, from sport, culture and well-being.
* We offer flexible and remote work opportunities so you can shape your work in the way that fits you best.

  

This role is available in Stockholm, Gothenburg or Malmö.


If you are ready to leave your mark at Eficode, please apply before 3 January 2025. Our team reviews applications on a rolling basis, so seize the opportunity to join us by submitting your application today! The position may be filled before the set end date.


We're looking forward to reading about you!

 *At Eficode we are committed to offering an inclusive recruitment process and equal opportunities for all applicants.*

*We are dedicated to creating a work environment that embraces diversity, inclusion, and respect for all employees. We believe that our differences make us better. We recognize that by having diverse perspectives, skills, ages, genders, backgrounds and cultures we will better drive our customers forward and innovate in our field.*

*To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from sharing unnecessary personal information and your picture on your job application.*

*Eficode, better made possible.*

title: Är du vår nästa konsult-stjärna?
description:
Vi söker både Scrum Masters och Business Analysts


**Nyfiken? Klicka här!**Nu söker **Stretch Amplify** flera kollegor som vill vara med och bidra till innovativa och effektiva lösningar!
På Stretch Amplify höjer vi våra kunders digitala utvecklingsförmåga med både teknik och metodik. Som agil utvecklingspartner hjälper vi våra kunder att ta vara på all den teknik som finns tillgänglig runt omkring oss för att skapa framtidens digitala tjänster och produkter.
Om du motiveras av att arbeta i utmanande projekt med ny teknik och affärsutveckling i tätt samarbete med våra kunder och kollegor så kommer du trivas hos oss!
**Om rollerna**
Vi söker fler stjärnor som vill ta sig an konsultuppdrag hos våra kunder i rollen som Scrum Master eller Business Analyst.
I båda rollerna spelar du en nyckelroll i att stärka samarbetet och leveransförmågan hos våra kunder. Med din erfarenhet och spetskompetens bidrar du till att främja effektiva agila arbetssätt och skapa långsiktigt värde för kundens organisation.**Saker vi vet är viktiga för att lyckas**
Du har ett par års erfarenhet av system/produktutveckling och ett stort intresse av moderna metoder och ramverk som Scrum, Kanban, DevOps, SAFe, LeSS m.fl.
Du har bred erfarenhet från att ha provat på olika branscher/industrier i roller som exempelvis Scrum Master, Produktägare, Business Analyst eller liknande
Du har en stark förmåga att lyssna in och kommunicera med olika personligheter, bygga relationer med intressenter och skapa en trygg teammiljö
Du har en problemlösande inställning, ett strukturerat arbetssätt och en vilja att kontinuerligt utvecklas och hjälpa andra att göra detsamma.
Du är förmodligen certifierad inom Scrum, Prosci, IIBA eller liknande
**Vi erbjuder**
En flexibel arbetsplats
Konferenser – digitala, fysiska, interna och externa!
Arbete i en mix av in-house leveranser och externa leveranser
Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling – i nya projekt, team och kunder
Nära till beslut – dina idéer är värdefulla och de vill vi satsa på!

**Vilka blir dina Stretchkollegor?**
Vi har lite olika bakgrund, men gemensamt är att vi är problemlösare som trivs med komplicerade frågeställningar och utmaningar. Vi vet att mjukvara och produktutveckling är komplext och därför har vi lämnat förlegade arbetssätt bakom oss. Våra gemensamma värdeord är Nyfiken, Omtanke och Resultat – vilket vi exemplifierar i våra uppdrag hos kund såväl som internt.
**Om Stretchgruppen**
Vi tror på alla människors vilja och förmåga att utveckla en bättre värld. Och att vi har ett kollektivt ansvar att skapa hållbara lösningar, för en bättre framtid för oss och kommande generationer. Vi kallar det för hållbart entreprenörskap.
Våra bolag erbjuder IT-tjänster och produkter som skapar starkare och tydligare affärsvärde. Varje bolag har sin egen väldefinierade marknad där kundernas digitalisering står i centrum.
Läs mer oss och våra värderingar på **Om Stretchgruppen - Stretch**
**Stretchgruppen**
**Stretch Amplify**
**Roll**
Scrum Master

**Malmö, Stora Nygatan 61**

Hybridarbete
**KONTAKT**

title: Architect - Technology
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.


At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative, and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story! We are looking for a Devops Architect-Technology to join our team.


**Job Description**

* As a DevOps Architect, responsible for designing, implementing, and managing robust and scalable solutions in a fast-paced, cloud-driven environment.
* Design, build, and implement scalable cloud architectures on Azure/AWS, ensuring high availability, security, and reliability.
* Develop and optimize continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to ensure efficient and automated software release cycles.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, QA, security) to identify and implement DevOps solutions aligned with business goals.
* Monitor and optimize system performance, availability, and capacity planning for cloud environments.
* Evaluate, recommend, and integrate new DevOps tools to improve the efficiency and scalability of development processes.
* Develop comprehensive documentation and provide training for engineering teams on DevOps best practices and new tools/technologies.
* Advanced experience with cloud platforms Azure or AWS with relevant certifications.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
* Experience with monitoring, logging, and alerting tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack)

**What you can expect**


* Market attractive Salary and compensation package
* Unique opportunity to become part of a ‘flag ship’ success story at the forefront of technological innovation - We go through enormous growth!
* Opportunity to work in a global Fortune 500 organization with strong local ambitions
* An agile, international and multicultural work environment
* Access to further training through our own Cognizant Academy to ensure professional development
* Opportunity to work with globally recognized organizations and C level stakeholders
* Work life balance – flexible working hours and 5 extra vacation days a year
* A fun and invigorating place to work
company_addresses: 500 Frank W. Burr Boulevard Teaneck, NJ 07666

title: DevOps Linux Konsult
description:
DevOps Linux Konsult till Camai – Är det dig vi söker?
  
Är du en skicklig DevOps-specialist som älskar Linux och vill ta nästa steg i din karriär? Camai letar efter en erfaren och passionerad DevOps Linux Konsult som vill vara med och forma framtiden inom modern IT-infrastruktur. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk och tekniskt utmanande miljö där du får arbeta med de senaste verktygen och teknologierna för att optimera våra kunders system.
  
Hos oss får du arbeta i en företagskultur som präglas av innovation, samarbete och kontinuerlig utveckling. Vi erbjuder:
  
Spännande projekt med stora kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor.
  
Möjlighet att använda de senaste teknologierna inom moln, automatisering och containerlösningar.
  
En arbetsplats där din expertis och dina idéer värdesätts och gör skillnad.
  
  

Om rollen
  
Som DevOps Linux Konsult hos Camai kommer du att arbeta i varierande projekt med fokus på att automatisera, effektivisera och skala system. Du kommer att:
  
Utveckla och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines för smidig leverans av applikationer.
  
Automatisera och övervaka applikationer med moderna verktyg som Jenkins, GitLab och Terraform.
  
Arbeta med Docker, Kubernetes och molnplattformar som AWS och/eller Azure, där du bygger skalbara och säkra lösningar.
  
Implementera verktyg som Ansible och Packer för konfigurationshantering och automatisering.
  
Hantera och optimera processer med hjälp av Atlassian-verktyg som Jira, Confluence och Bitbucket.
  
Vara en nyckelspelare i att implementera agila arbetssätt och skapa stabila systemarkitekturer baserade på mikrotjänster eller monoliter beroende på behov.
  
Delta i projekt med stort ansvar där du självständigt driver processer och får stöttning av teamet vid behov.
  
  

Vad vi söker
  
Vi söker dig som har en stark teknisk bakgrund, ett analytiskt sinne och en vilja att ta ansvar för helheten i komplexa projekt. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du:
  
Minst 1 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling i en Linux-baserad miljö med Java EE.
  
Flerårig erfarenhet av containerteknologier som Docker och Kubernetes.
  
Gedigna kunskaper i scriptspråk som Bash, Groovy eller Python.
  
Daglig erfarenhet av Terraform för infrastruktur som kod.
  
Erfarenhet av verktyg för automatisering och konfiguration som Ansible och Packer.
  
God vana vid Atlassian-programvara såsom Jira, Confluence och Bitbucket.
  
En agil mindset och erfarenhet av arbetssätt som Scrum.
  
Erfarenhet av automatisering av delivery pipelines och applikationsövervakning.
  
Förståelse för systemarkitekturer och teknologival mellan mikrotjänster och monoliter.
  
Goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
  
  

**Start:** Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare
  
**Placeringsort:** Stockholm
  
**Ansökan:** Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match
  
  

**Vad vi står för:** Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
  
Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
  
Varför ska du välja oss?Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.
  
Vill du vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt?

title: DevOps Uppdragsledare – Luleå
description:
Kunden söker en uppdragsledare för att leda förstudiearbetet för införandet av DevOps i deras organisation. Uppdraget innebär att utveckla en detaljerad plan för hur DevOps-principer och metoder ska implementeras för att optimera arbetsflöden och effektivisera utvecklingsprocesserna. Den valda resursen ska vara tillgänglig på 100% och arbetar både på distans och på plats vid behov. Första veckan krävs närvaro på plats tre dagar, med därefter en plan för närvaro på plats två dagar var tredje vecka eller enligt överenskommelse.
  
Kunden är en stor offentlig myndighet med ansvar för att säkerställa flödet av varor och skydda landets gränser. IT-avdelningen är belägen i Luleå och består av ett stort team av anställda och konsulter.
  
  

**Obligatoriska krav för uppdraget:**  

– Dokumenterad erfarenhet av uppdragsledning och införande av DevOps.
  
– Minst fem års erfarenhet av uppdragsledning inom IT.
  
– Erfarenhet av att genomföra utredningar och analyser av IT-system och IT-miljöer, samt att ta fram beslutsunderlag.
  
– Djupgående kunskap om agila arbetsmetoder och hur dessa tillämpas i projekt och team.
  
– Förmåga att uttrycka sig tydligt och professionellt i både tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.
  
– Svenskt medborgarskap.
  
  

**Meriterande kompetenser:**  

– Erfarenhet av systemutveckling och teknisk bakgrund inom området.
  
– Kunskap och erfarenhet av CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment).
  
– Erfarenhet av att arbeta med automatiserade flöden och processer inom systemutveckling.
  
Den ideala kandidaten för detta uppdrag kommer att ha en kombination av teknisk och ledningsmässig kompetens, samt erfarenhet av att leda komplexa IT-projekt och utvecklingsinitiativ inom offentlig sektor.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

  

* Software and/or release engineering experience
* Ability to understand and work with complex releasing systems
* Algorithmization and scripting ability (Groovy, Python, PowerShell, Bash or any programming language)
* CI/CD software (Preferably Jenkins, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, any other similar automation software)
* Docker experience (including creating images, Docker networking and Docker Compose).
* Strong experience with AWS - IAM,EC2,VPC,S3,ECS,Lambdas
* Using Terraform on a daily basis
* Ansible and Packer experience
* Windows and Linux experience - (we are working on both OS)
* Experience with Atlassian software (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket)


  

**Meritorious**  

* Experience with releasing C++, Java, C#/.NET, or JS/TS/NodeJS applications
* Experience with SQL, NoSQL databases, or MQs
* Experience with Kubernetes
* Advanced release concepts experience - releases of SaaS, releases to the cloud, feature flagging, canary releases
* Experience with large-scale or distributed systems, SOA

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 11-12-2024  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  


  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**At Capgemini, your career is in your hands. We're not just a company; we're a community where your growth is empowered, collaboration is second nature, and innovation knows no bounds. With a global network of inspiring colleagues, you’ll reimagine what's possible while shaping a career that truly fits you.**  

  

**We’re now looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our Cloud & Custom Application (C&CA) team in Stockholm, Malmö, or Helsingborg.**

  

**YOUR ROLE**  

**As a DevOps Engineer, you’ll partner with clients on exciting, high-impact projects that define the future of digital transformation. You’ll:**  



* **Design and implement DevOps solutions, making software delivery faster, more secure, and more reliable.**
* **Serve as a trusted advisor, guiding clients on DevOps principles and best practices.**
* **Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create real-world solutions.**

**YOUR PROFILE**   

**Below we list your Tech Toolkit. While you don’t need to know it all, experience with one or two tools in each category will set you up for success:**  



* **Cloud: Azure. Familiarity with AWS and/or GCP is meritorious**
* **CI/CD: GitHub, GitLab**
* **Infrastructure, IaC: Terraform, Ansible, Bicep, AMR and CloudFormation**
* **Scripting: proficient in at least one scripting language, e.g. Python**
* **Development: comfortable working with one of the major development languages such as Java or C#**
* **Monitoring: Splunk, Datalog**
* **Workload Deployment: Kubernetes**
* **Tools: Artifactory, Vault, ELK**
* **Security: experience in encrypting, firewalls and working with intrusion detection systems. Meriting with experience from tools like SonarQube**

**What we are looking for:**

* **Experience: 4+ years in a relevant role (e.g., DevOps engineer, cloud engineer, or software developer with DevOps responsibilities)**
* **Education: Background in software engineering or a similar field**
* **Full proficiency in English, speech and writing**
* **Knowledge of the Swedish language in speech and writing is meritorious**

**WHAT WE BELIEVE YOU WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE**

* **We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.**
* **At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.**
* **Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies such as AWS and Microsoft Azure.**

**APPLICATION**  

**Send in your application as soon as possible, we review applications on an ongoing basis.**

  

**ABOUT CAPGEMINI**

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**

**#LI-ET1**

**Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com**

title: Big Deals Solution Lead
description:
**Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.**

**YOUR ROLE**  

**This person will have full ownership for the solution of multiyear multi tower outsourcing deals > € 50 M and therefore, must have the appropriate experience. Typically, part of a team and working closely with the Sales and Commercial Lead to shape the solution in all dimensions.**  

* **Develop the overarching solution strategy that brings together the client objectives on one hand and the best of Capgemini GBLs, practices, and service lines on the other hand**
* **Bring your experience in transformational deals, transitioning from traditional models to agile, DevOps, and product-oriented approaches.**
* **Lead solution development across a few towers and for the rest of the towers provide guidance and direction to align with the broader solution strategy**
* **Work closely with Sales and Commercial Leads and engage with experts across the organization to deliver comprehensive solutions.**
* **Covering all aspects of the IT landscape and software development lifecycle (build to run) with good understanding to lead discussions internally and externally**
* **Establish and nurture relationships with clients at all levels, from operational teams to CxOs, ensuring their needs are met throughout the deal pursuit process**
* **Taking end-to-end ownership of the solution during the pursuit process – working closely with experts from all areas of the organization**
**YOUR PROFILE**  

* **Multiple years of experience ideally with delivery background and other roles, experience in leading solutions for multi-tower, complex deals**
* **Preferably consulting experience to shape deals from RFI to RFP, BAFO, and contracting.**
* **Preferably, experience across multiple industry sectors and technologies**
* **Strong communication, collaboration, and presentation skills – presenting and defending the solution internally and externally at operational to CXO levels, representing the ownership and pushing for best outcomes even on short notice and under pressure**
* **Experience on all levels with client organization up-to CxO level - Establishing and nurturing client relationships (operational, senior management and CxOs) during deal pursuits**
* **Good understanding of current and emerging offerings in the industry such as cloud, digital, and cybersecurity**
* **Good understanding of contracting and commercials, complex pricing models**
* **Ability to lead, orchestrate and motivate large (20-100) leveraged teams for the deal duration**
* **Experience in Transformational deals covering e.g., transforming to target platforms, operating model from traditional waterfall to agile, DevOps or product orientation etc.**
* **Strong problem-solving skills and a creative approach to tackle complex challenges.**
* **A self-motivated personality with the capacity of multi-tasking, ability to accept change and drive to win**
**WHAT WE BELIEVE YOU WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE**  

* **We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.**
* **At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.**
**ABOUT CAPGEMINI**  

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**

title: Architect - Technology
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
  
At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative, and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story! We are looking for a Devops Architect-Technology to join our team.
  
Job Description
  
As a DevOps Architect, responsible for designing, implementing, and managing robust and scalable solutions in a fast-paced, cloud-driven environment.
  
Design, build, and implement scalable cloud architectures on Azure/AWS, ensuring high availability, security, and reliability.
  
Develop and optimize continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to ensure efficient and automated software release cycles.
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, QA, security) to identify and implement DevOps solutions aligned with business goals.
  
Monitor and optimize system performance, availability, and capacity planning for cloud environments.
  
Evaluate, recommend, and integrate new DevOps tools to improve the efficiency and scalability of development processes.
  
Develop comprehensive documentation and provide training for engineering teams on DevOps best practices and new tools/technologies.
  
Advanced experience with cloud platforms Azure or AWS with relevant certifications.
  
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
  
Experience with monitoring, logging, and alerting tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack)
  
  

What you can expect
  
Market attractive Salary and compensation package
  
Unique opportunity to become part of a ‘flag ship’ success story at the forefront of technological innovation - We go through enormous growth!
  
Opportunity to work in a global Fortune 500 organization with strong local ambitions
  
An agile, international and multicultural work environment
  
Access to further training through our own Cognizant Academy to ensure professional development
  
Opportunity to work with globally recognized organizations and C level stakeholders
  
Work life balance – flexible working hours and 5 extra vacation days a year
  
A fun and invigorating place to work
company_addresses: 500 Frank W. Burr Boulevard Teaneck, NJ 07666

title: Senior Dynamics 365 CE konsult/arkitekt med stort hjärta
description:
Det går bra för Fellowmind som helhet och i synnerhet för vårt affärsområde Customer Applications, där vi hjälper våra kunder med implementation och vidareutveckling av CRM inom ramen för Dynamics-plattformen. Vi har en rad riktigt spännande pågående projekt och ytterligare nya som drar igång förstudier i höst. Till det söker vi nu en (eller två eller tre…) senior konsult/arkitekt inom Dynamics 365 CE.

**Vilka är vi då?**
-------------------


Vi på Fellowmind är en ledande Europeisk Microsoft-partner som hjälper till att göra den digitala transformationen snabbare för våra kunder genom att använda Microsofts molnlösningar, uppmuntra smidig utveckling, implementera integrerade molnlösningar och hjälpa slutanvändarna att lära sig och anpassa sig till nya lösningar. Vi får människor att trivas med att arbeta med teknologin och får teknologin att fungera för dem. Vi hjälper bland annat våra kunder inom områden som ERP, CRM, Data & AI, Modern Work, Cloud & Security Infrastructure för att nämna några.


Fellowmind är ett värderingsstyrt bolag och med våra värderingar Always personal, Act with courage, Better together och Serious about fun har vi som mål att vara branschens bästa arbetsgivare. Vi tror på att bygga en levande och personlig arbetskultur där alla trivs, utvecklas och kan blomstra.

**Om tjänsten**
---------------


I den här rollen förväntar vi oss att du är så pass senior att du kan ta på dig olika ”hattar” utifrån vad olika projekt kräver och ta rollen som lösningsarkitekt eller streamlead. Du kommer att arbeta med både implementationsprojekt för nya kunder och vidareutveckling av befintliga. Du är delaktig i hela projekt, från förstudie till uppsättning och har en nyckelroll i att ta fram lösningar i teknisk framkant. Arbetet sker i projektform och ofta arbetar du i flera projekt parallellt.


Hos oss är du med i den kreativa dialogen med kund för att genom processkartläggning kunna ta fram bästa löningen. Du är såklart med i utförandet där du både konfigurerar, anpassar och sätter upp systemet. Rollen innefattar även utbildning av lösningen till våra kunder.


Tillsammans med teamet från Fellowmind, bestående av applikationskonsulter, systemutvecklare, lösningsarkitekter och projektledare hittar ni de bästa lösningarna för varje kunds unika behov och realiserar dessa. Projektteamet från Fellowmind ser olika ut i olika projekt och du samarbetar med kollegor från olika kontor och expertområden. Ofta kommer du även vara involverad i plattformsprojekt som förutom CRM även spänner över områden som exempelvis ERP, BI eller Modern Work.

#### **Exempel på arbetsuppgifter och ansvarsområde:**

* Rapportering till projektledning
* Riskhantering
* Övergripande ansvar DevOps "Går vi åt rätt håll?", kontrollera progress och teamets arbetsfördelning
* Leda planerings- och check-in möten
* Ansvara för Blueprints
* Utveckling av lösning tillsammans med Microsoft
* Cross stream diskussion
* DevOps GAP/Integrationer
* Tekniskt ansvar för lösning
* Ansvar FDD

**Vem är du?**
--------------


Vi söker dig som idag jobbar som senior applikationskonsult/lösningsarkitekt inom Dynamics 365CE och gärna med spetskompetens inom Sales och/eller Customer Service. Troligen har du jobbat i en likande roll i minst 3 år (gärna fler) och känner ett sug att ta dig an ett större och mer komplexa projekt som spänner över hela Dynamicsplattformen.


Som person har du en stor portion driv och målmedvetenhet. Likaså du är positiv, öppen och gillar utmaningar. Du utstrålar energi, är trygg i dig själv och har en ambition att ständigt utvecklas. Det är tydligt att du trivs som bäst i kontakten med kund och dina kollegor. Lika mycket som du gillar att grotta ner dig i tekniska detaljer med en kollega kan du uppskatta att bryta av med en go’ kaffe, biljard-match, afterwork eller tränings-vända. Du är därtill mån om kvalitén på det arbete du gör vilket gör att du håller dig uppdaterad inom den senaste tekniken i ditt område.


Och givetvis som vi skriver i titel och inledning; ett stort hjärta för det du tar dig an!

**Det praktiska**
-----------------


Start: Gärna så snart som möjligt, men vi har förståelse för att du har uppsägningstid att ta hänsyn till.


Omfattning: Heltid, kontorstider, men vi är givetvis flexibla och utgår från att det ska fungera för alla parter.


Placering: På något av våra kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Jönköping, Malmö eller Halmstad


Rekryteringsprocessen kommer bestå av telefon/teamsintervju, djupintervjuer, test/case och referenstagning. Vi tillämpar löpande urval och läser alla ansökningar löpande.

title: Senior Cloud Data-Warehouse Test Engineer \u007C SEB, Solna
description:
At SEB, we’re not just a bank with an IT department—we’re a forward-thinking tech company driven by innovation and collaboration. Our tech community thrives on exploring cutting-edge solutions and creating a sustainable future for all. Whether you're drawn to exploring advanced technology stacks or taking bold steps in data innovation, SEB is where your expertise can shine. **About the role**
We’re looking for a passionate and skilled technical tester to join our dynamic team as we build a state-of-the-art Cloud Data Warehouse for our Trading division. In this high-priority role, you’ll delve into complex trade data and play a key part in revolutionizing our Trading Regulatory Reporting. If data and innovation excite you, we want to hear from you! **What You’ll Do*** Work hands-on with regulatory business development in an Agile environment, leveraging Scrum and SAFe methodologies.
* Design and execute test strategies for our new Google Cloud-based data warehouse to support trading operations.
* Partner with diverse teams to identify opportunities, implement continuous improvements, and explore innovative solutions.
* Debug, analyze, and ensure quality across all stages of development.

 **To thrive in this role, we believe you have**
You have a curious mind, a detail-oriented approach, and a knack for solving challenges. You thrive in collaborative settings and enjoy thinking outside the box. Ideally, you have:* Solid experience with SQL and Data Warehouse testing.
* A strong grasp of test automation and version control systems (like Git).
* An Agile mindset with a commitment to continuous learning.

 **Bonus Points If You Have*** Experience with GCP or other cloud platforms.
* ISTQB certification.
* Familiarity with tools like Dataform or practices such as Data Warehouse monitoring and alerting.

 **What we offer*** Work on exciting projects where your expertise drives tangible results.
* Lead initiatives in building a robust, scalable, and automated testing framework on Google Cloud.
* Be part of a talented, inclusive, and humble team that believes in openness and collaboration.
* Enjoy learning through pair-programming, mob-programming, and engaging demos.
* Experience a culture that values you as an individual while celebrating the power of teamwork.

  

At SEB, we’re not just building a data warehouse—we’re creating an inclusive tech space where everyone can innovate and grow. If you’re ready to make an impact, we’d love to welcome you to our team!
Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
Since we review applications and select potential candidates on a continuous basis, you are welcome to send your application as soon as possible, but no later than 6th of January 2025. For questions regarding the position or the recruitment process, please contact Team manager Ali Rezai at ali.rezai@seb.se or Talent Acquisition Partner at karl.saeter@seb.se. ***Please note that due to the holiday season, it might take us a little longer to get back to you, but we truly appreciate your patience and enthusiasm.***  

Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers  

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Regional Sales Manager, Mid-South
description:
**An Amazing Career Opportunity for a Regional Sales Manager, Mid-South!!**
**Location: Austin, Texas- US** **Mid-south (Remote)**
**Job ID: 34341**  


Reporting to the Territory Sales Director, the Regional Account Manager’s primary responsibilities are to protect and grow existing revenues, maximize HID installed base market share, and strengthen product selection policies through strategic planning and relationship building with HID customers within their specified region. The Regional Account Manager’s must effectively identify new project opportunities throughout multiple levels within customer organizations including senior management and all subsequent departments essential to advancing HID Global’s market position. Candidate must effectively manage all sales, service and other challenges associated with HID Global products and services.  


**Who are we?**
HID Global powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places, and things, allowing people to transact safely, work productively and travel freely.
We are a high-tech software company headquartered in Austin, TX, with over 4,000 worldwide employees. Check us out here: www.hidglobal.com and https://youtu.be/23km5H4K9Eo  


  

**HID’s Physical Access Control Solutions Department:**  


HID Physical Access Control Solutions (PACS) is at the forefront of securing spaces with advanced, reliable access control solutions. From cutting-edge readers, credentials and controllers, to mobile and biometric technologies, HID PACS empowers organizations worldwide to protect their people, property and assets with scalable, high-quality solutions.
This is more than just a job – it’s your chance to join an industry leader to drive innovation in access control and make a real impact on global security solutions.
Are you ready to make a difference? Join us and help shape the future of security.  


**As our Regional Sales Manager, Mid-South, you’ll support HID’s success by:**  


* Promoting and selling HID products and services to existing and new customers or channels
* Identifying and building strategic relationships within ALL assigned customer accounts, both direct/indirect
* Identifying and participating on all major project opportunities, as required
* Following up by providing technical and tactical support to project completion
* Providing technical and applications training, as required, for existing and new products at all levels and departments within customer organizations (i.e., Sales, Service/Operations, Procurement, and Key Mgmt.)
* Participating in all local, regional and national security trade shows, as required or directed, by the Territory Sales Director
* Monitoring and achieving on a monthly/quarterly basis new business and volume goals
* Preparing quarterly and annual Business Plan for assigned territory, as required
* Participating in regularly scheduled teleconference meetings
* Measures and monitors HID market share penetration in the territory, as required
* Initiating calls to existing or prospective clients to determine use and needs of HID products
* Achieving total customer satisfaction by interacting with assigned group of customers and HID management
* Establishing communications with all departments to facilitate the resolution of customer related problems
* Tracking and reporting on leads, opportunities, and sales by means of periodic activity reports though Salesforce CMS
* Participating as a member of NAM PACS Regional Sales team, working closely to identify improvement opportunities, developmental needs and account growth
* Preparing and delivering presentations to assigned account base, as required

  


**What we will love about your background:**  


* Proficient in MS Office applications, such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
* Familiar with operating systems, such as Windows, etc.
* Experience with Salesforce.com
* Effective management of customer requirements and expectations
* Demonstrated history of excellence in customer service
* Customer-first philosophy that drives day-to-day activities
* Always focused on achieving a reputation for being a “trusted advisor”
* Ability to effectively communicate in the English language, both verbally and in writing
* Ability to read and interpret technical journals, specifications, international technical standards, etc.

  


**Your Experience and Education include:**  


* BA/BS degree in a related field highly-desired (will consider 5+ years of experience in the physical security industry)
* A minimum of 5+ years outside sales experience.
* Experience in IoT and Cloud Services desired
* Must possess excellent skills in time management, written/verbal communication and organization, with the ability to adhere to deadlines
* Must also demonstrate sound judgment and decision making ability

  


**Who you are as a Team Member:**  


* Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal
* Willingness to ‘roll up sleeves’ and dive deep into tactical work when necessary
* Good interpersonal skills, willingness to learn and continue to grow professionally
* Strong team player and ability to work well with others

  


**Why apply?**  


* **Empowerment:** You’ll work as part of a global team in a flexible work environment, learning and enhancing your expertise
* **Innovation:** You embrace challenges and want to drive ambitious change
* **Integrity:** You are results-orientated, reliable, and straightforward and value being treated accordingly

  


HID is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer – Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.  


**We make it easier for people to get where they want to go!**  

On an average day, think of how many times you tap, twist, tag, push or swipe to get access, find information, connect with others or track something. HID technology is behind billions of interactions, in more than 100 countries. We help you create a verified, trusted identity that can get you where you need to go – without having to think about it.  

  

When you join our HID team, you’ll also be part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. You’ll have 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally. As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
 #LI-HIDGlobal

title: Finnish & Swedish speaking Customer Support Specialist (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
We are looking for a Finnish & Swedish speaking Customer Support Specialist who wants to be part of Tietoevry Banking. Tietoevry Banking is the leading financial services software and solution partner in the Nordics. We offer modular, pre-integrated banking as a service solutions and market-leading software for core, payments, credit, cards, financial fraud, and wealth. With our scale, expertise, and specialization, we empower financial institutions to enhance agility, efficiency, and accelerate digital transformation.  

When joining Tietoevry Banking as a Finnish & Swedish speaking Customer Support Consultant:
As a Finnish-speaking customer service representative at Tietoevry Banking, you will work independently handling incoming calls and providing high-quality service to customers. The majority of your tasks will involve financial services and supporting the bank's end customers, such as card blocking and more. Your work will be carried out in Finnish as well as Swedish and English.
This position offers you the opportunity to work with a fantastic team of 9 individuals where good collaboration and a pleasant work environment are highly valued. We are staffed around the clock, which means that shifts may occur during daytime, evenings, nighttime, and weekends/holidays  

Employment Type: Fixed-term employment - hourly
Job Responsibilities:* Handle incoming calls from customers, primarily individuals but also stores and bank personnel, and assist them with their inquiries.
* Make follow-up calls on submitted cases.
* Register all incoming cases in various systems.
* Resolve incoming cases based on the situation.
* Provide top-level service and customer interaction to ensure the best solution for the customer's situation.
* Work towards creating and developing good collaborations with the company's customers.


Who we are looking for:* Speaks and writes Finnish, Swedish, and English fluently.
* Has previous experience in a customer service role where you interacted with individuals, via phone, in-store, restaurant, etc.
* Has a high school diploma.
* Is service-minded.
* Has good computer skills.


Personal Qualities
Since we offer 24/7 support, we are looking for someone who is flexible, loyal, and solution-oriented. You should be responsible and structured in your work approach and capable of providing professional customer interaction in all situations. Additionally, you should be meticulous in your work to always ensure the highest quality of service to the customer. There may also be periods of higher workload, so we expect you to handle stressful situations and communicate easily with colleagues. We place the greatest emphasis on personal qualities.  

We Offer
We offer you an exciting position at one of the Nordics' largest IT companies that is growing both nationally and internationally. We work in a professional environment that will give you the chance to develop and grow through taking on exciting challenges and learning. Currently, we provide a hybrid work model with two fixed days a week in our new and nice offices in Solna.  

Did we get you inspired?
We look forward to your application!  

Attach your CV or LinkedIn profile, and we will get in touch with you. Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager, Jonna Winqvist, at jonna.winqvist@tietoevry.com.
Hope to hear from you soon!  

Location: Stockholm - Solna  

We perform background checks on all final candidates.  

About Tietoevry
Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Senior DevSecOps Engineer
description:
**Location** Gothenburg, Sweden (on-site)

**Job****Description** Senior DevSecOps Engineer

**Role:**

We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced DevSecOps Engineer. While prior experience with Microsoft Azure services is a plus, we value a solid foundation in cloud infrastructure maintenance, integration setup, and a good understanding of IT service management processes.Your commitment to delivering exceptional support to our internal products will be crucial in this role with the below,

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Manage incident and problem resolution related to Azure SQL Database.
* Engage in effective communication with customers while addressing specific incidents.
* Collaborate with other support teams, including third-party vendors, when necessary, to escalate and resolve incidents.
* Keep customers informed about monitored performance issues in Azure SQL Database.
* Handle Azure SQL Database access management.
* Act on behalf of the application team to manage tasks such as,
* Migrations,
* Version Upgrades,
* Resource requirements,
* Cost Assessments & SLAs
* Assess disaster recovery strategies and solutions as needed.
* Monitoring & troubleshooting issues in Kubernetes/OpenShift clusters.
* Stay up-to-date with Azure security tools and best practices.
* Participate in incident response and security incident investigations.
* Provide support during the standard 9-to-5 CET working hours, acknowledging the potential expansion to 24/7 support and/or on call support beginning in 2025.

**Required Qualification:**​​

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Security, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Good communication skills and stakeholder management experience.
* Experience in Container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes and OpenShift.
* Proficiency in creating operational and design documentation for the solutions you develop/build artefacts, along with the ability to write post-incident reports after addressing/troubleshooting service-related issues.
* Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools, such as Ansible and Terraform.
* Competence in working with Azure-hosted databases and virtual machines.
* Experience in utilizing Azure monitoring and logging tools.
* Knowledge of high-availability Azure services.
* Understanding of Networking and Cloud Infrastructure within the Azure environment.
* Familiarity with Azure backup solutions.
* Capability to propose/follow security best practices.
* Experience working with Splunk as a monitoring tool is a plus.
* Experience with security testing tools and vulnerability assessment is a plus.

**​Email- bhawna.gugnani@swediumglobal.com**

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Swedium Global is looking for Senior Machine Learning Engineer

The primary tasks for a Machine Learning Engineer in MLE area are:  
Develop AI/ML software products including but not limited to explore large data set, try out new algorithms, feature engineering, test and  
evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usage and scale out to the comprehensive fashion network of the  
company.

* Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects.

* Familiar with agile ways of working, team collaboration, data-driven development, reliable and responsible experimentation.

title: Datacenter Engineering: Senior Design Manager - EMEA
description:
Microsoft Cloud Operations and Innovation (CO&I) is the team behind the cloud. Within CO&I, the Datacenter Engineering (DCE) team is responsible for delivering core datacenter infrastructure for Microsoft’s cloud business. The MS portfolio consists of complex, multi-disciplinary, large scale, multi-year datacenter construction and lease projects. We are looking for a passionate, high-energy individual to help build the cloud datacenters that power the world’s largest online services.  

In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.**Responsibilities**
--------------------


Reporting to the Datacenter Engineering Northern EMEA DM Lead plus Nordics Sub-Regional DM Lead, the Design Manager will be assigned to manage the engineering scope, schedule, and budget for greenfield, brownfield and retrofit engineering / design projects through all stages of the project from site due diligence, design and construction as assigned in Sweden and in other EMEA locations as required. The Design Manager will;* manage internal and external resources for the delivery of land technical due diligence, construction permitting, engineering/designing the building shell/core, power, cooling, telecom and controls infrastructure to align with Microsoft IT capacity roadmap for builds.
* provide design management, technical direction, decision-making and overall leadership for our datacenter architectural / engineering designs.


The candidate will oversee the delivery of multiple, concurrent, complete Datacenter design solutions aligned with the scopes, schedules, and budgets of the projects, and manage the design deliverables of MS consultants (architects, engineers, and designers)
Engage with key MS stakeholder groups within Microsoft as well as outside vendors who specialize in datacenter architecture and engineering.**Knowledge, experience and skills:*** The candidate must have excellent communication, organization, and leadership skills.
* Candidates must possess a high level of proficiency in commercial and industrial architecture and engineering with a primary focus on datacenter design.
* The candidates must also be able to work with other technical and non-technical groups in a fast- paced environment and do so with an even temperament.
* The candidate must be a person of integrity, be methodical, detailed-oriented with a strong work ethic.
* Ability to lead teams of engineers in advanced engineering and operational processes and procedures as they relate to large datacenter environments
* Contract negotiation skills with solid understanding of value-added ideas without compromising safety and quality of deliverables
* Ability to get things done in fast-paced environment; not easily discouraged; forward looking with open mindset
* Knowledge of local building codes, regulations, and jurisdictional standards
* Ability to prepare and present using MS office packages
* Able to travel domestically and internationally
* Large scale project experience (100MW per project) delivering Design Build, and Design Bid Build type projects
* Have good experience in running technical site due diligence programmes
* Demonstrate a good track record in data centre / mission critical section

 **Preferred, not required:** Chartered / Professional Engineer / Project Manager or Registered Architect.**Qualifications**
------------------


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Architecture, or equivalent in construction/design management.**Significant** years’ of experience in delivering engineering / construction infrastructure projects**Good** years’ of experience as lead engineer, lead architect, design manager or project manager for large scale complex infrastructure projects
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to, the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
Chartered / Professional Engineer / Project Manager or Registered Architect  


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.
